intro: Oxydectes glyptosperma, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Oxydectes glyptosperma thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
